‚≠ê Impact of Tumor Arterial Embolization on Hemodynamics During Surgical Resection of Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma in Children. ‚Äî This retrospective study suggests that preoperative tumor arterial embolization does not reduce intraoperative hemodynam

top_items.bottom_line: This Swedish registry study estimates that only 1.4%‚Äì7.8% of witnessed out-of-hospital cardiac arrests are eligible for ECPR, with eligibility highly dependent on selection criteria and transport times; this highlights the limited but potentially significant impact of ECPR in real-world practice and underscores the importance of system-level planning for its implementation.
top_items.title: Eligibility for Extracorporeal Cardio-Pulmonary Resuscitation in Out-of-Hospital Cardiac Arrests in Sweden.

top_items.bottom_line: This retrospective study suggests that preoperative tumor arterial embolization does not reduce intraoperative hemodynamic instability or blood loss overall in children undergoing pheochromocytoma or paraganglioma resection, but may help high-risk patients with large or highly active tumors achieve outcomes similar to lower-risk cases; evidence is limited by small sample size and retrospective design, but findings may guide perioperative planning in pediatric high-risk cases.
top_items.title: Impact of Tumor Arterial Embolization on Hemodynamics During Surgical Resection of Pheochromocytoma and Paraganglioma in Children.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: This comprehensive review article discusses current best practices and challenges in tracheal intubation for head and neck surgery, emphasizing the importance of advanced airway techniques, thorough preoperative evaluation, and multidisciplinary collaboration, but does not present new clinical trial data or original research findings.
top_items.title: Tracheal intubation techniques in head and neck surgery: navigating challenges and enhancing airway safety

top_items.bottom_line: In this single-centre randomized controlled trial, extending individualised goal-directed fluid and blood pressure therapy into the postoperative period after oesophagectomy did not reduce postoperative morbidity compared to standard care, suggesting no clinical benefit from this more intensive approach despite increased fluid and vasopressor use.
top_items.title: Individualised Perioperative Blood Pressure and Fluid Therapy in Oesophagectomy a prospective, single-blind randomised controlled trial.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: In a multicenter, double-blind, placebo-controlled randomized controlled trial, intercostal nerve block (ICNB) was found to outperform erector spinae plane block (ESPB) for reducing postoperative pain and opioid requirements in the early period after uniportal video-assisted thoracoscopic surgery (VATS), without compromising safety.
top_items.title: Intercostal nerve block outperforms ESPB for uniportal VATS

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: The 2026 ASA Practice Guideline provides updated, evidence-based recommendations emphasizing the use of fascial plane blocks for perioperative pain management in cardiothoracic, mastectomy, and abdominal surgeries across age groups, aiming to reduce postoperative pain and opioid use, with recommendations tailored by procedure type, invasiveness, and patient age; evidence quality varies from moderate to low.
top_items.title: New ASA recommendations for surgical pain relief

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: The SOFA trial, a single-center randomized controlled study, found that opioid-free anesthesia‚Äîusing agents such as ketamine, lidocaine, clonidine, and magnesium sulfate‚Äîwas compared to standard opioid-based anesthesia in major surgery, providing important evidence on postoperative recovery quality and opioid-related complication reduction, though specific outcome data are not detailed in this excerpt.
top_items.title: Opioid-free anesthesia in major surgery

top_items.bottom_line: ESAIC is transitioning to the GRADE methodology for guideline development starting in 2025, aiming to improve rigor, transparency, and clinical applicability; this shift is expected to enhance the quality and trustworthiness of future anaesthesiology and intensive care guidelines.
top_items.title: Methodology series of ESAIC guidelines: standards in guidelines production.

top_items.bottom_line: In this large multicenter retrospective cohort study of over 770,000 deliveries, peripartum, peri-anesthetic maternal cardiac arrest was rare (11.2 per 100,000), most often due to hemorrhage or amniotic fluid embolism, with two-thirds of patients surviving to 30 days; key risk factors included advanced maternal age, high BMI, certain racial groups, and specific clinical conditions, highlighting the need for targeted prevention
top_items.title: Frequency and Management of Maternal Peripartum Cardiac Arrest: A Multicenter Retrospective Cohort Analysis.

top_items.bottom_line: This systematic review and meta-analysis found that preoperative frailty, as measured by validated tools, is common in older adults undergoing major cardiac procedures and is strongly associated with increased risks of postoperative complications, longer hospital stays, nonhome discharge, readmission, and higher 30-day and 1-year mortality, underscoring the importance of frailty assessment in preoperative cardiac risk stratification.
top_items.title: Association of Preoperative Frailty and Postoperative Outcomes in Older Adults Undergoing Major Cardiac Procedures: A Systematic Review and Meta-Analysis.

top_items.bottom_line: This large multicentre UK study found that known and predicted difficult airways are common in ICU patients, yet most at-risk individuals are not clearly identified or provided with airway management plans, highlighting a significant gap in airway safety practices that warrants urgent clinical attention.
top_items.title: Identification of difficult airways in critical care units (ID-ACCT): a multicentre, survey-based prospective observational study.

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: A new prospective study indicates that radiofrequency ablation (RFA) for lumbar spinal arthritis not only reduces pain but also significantly improves walking speed, demonstrating that RFA enhances functional mobility as measured by objective gait analysis in patients with facet-mediated low back pain.
top_items.title: Radiofrequency ablation boosts mobility in lumbar spinal arthritis

top_items.bottom_line: BOTTOM LINE: This article provides an educational overview of discussions at a recent NYSORA event, highlighting the evolving focus on multimodal, non-opioid pain management strategies in cardiac and thoracic surgery, but does not present new clinical trial data or original research findings.
top_items.title: Industry Spotlight at NYSORA Events: Advancing Non-Opioid Pain Management in Cardiac and Thoracic Surgery

top_items.bottom_line: This small pilot pharmacokinetic study found that prolonged remimazolam infusion (‚â•24 h) in both surgical and medical ICU patients resulted in stable and predictable plasma concentrations with no significant differences between groups, suggesting its potential suitability for long-term sedation in critically ill patients, though larger studies are needed to confirm safety and efficacy.
top_items.title: Prolonged infusion of remimazolam in surgical and medical intensive care unit patients: a pilot pharmacokinetic study.
